import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : ℕ) (h : 17 ≤ n)
    : (choose n 15 / choose n 17 : ℚ) = 272 * (1/(n-16) - 1/(n-15)) := by
  have h15 : 15 ≤ n := by linarith
  have h17 : 17 ≤ n := by linarith
  calc (choose n 15 / choose n 17 : ℚ)
    _ = (n ! / (15! * (n-15)!)) / choose n 17 := by
        rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h15]
        sorry
    _ = (n ! / (15! * (n-15)!)) / (n ! / (17! * (n-17)!)) := by
        rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h17]
        sorry
    _ = (n ! / (15! * (n-15)!)) * ((17! * (n-17)!) / n !) := by sorry
    _ = (17! * (n-17)!) / (15! * (n-15)!) := by sorry
    _ = (17! / 15!) * ((n-17)! / (n-15)!) := by apply mul_div_mul_comm
    _ = ((17 * 16!) / 15!) * ((n-17)! / (n-15)!) := by sorry
    _ = ((17 * 16) * 15! / 15!) * ((n-17)! / (n-15)!) := by sorry
    _ = (17 * 16) * ((n-17)! / (n-15)!) := by sorry
    _ = 272 * ((n-17)! / (n-15)!) := by sorry
    _ = 272 * ((n-17)! / ((n-15) * (n-16)!)) := by sorry
    _ = 272 * ((n-17)! / ((n-15) * (n-16) * (n-17)!)) := by sorry
    _ = 272 * (1 / ((n-15) * (n-16))) := by sorry
    _ = 272 * (1/(n-16) - 1/(n-15)) := by sorry
Maybe rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h]???

Hi, I've got a question. h says that n has a minimum value of 17, but there is a denominator on the right hand side in the expression 1 / (n - 17) which becomes 1 / 0. Is that intentional? I know that Mathlib has 1 / 0 = 0, but I think that case is generally avoided in Mathlib by including a hypothesis that forbids it from happening.
Ah you're right. Should be a strict inequality.
Is there a tactic that says "cancel stuff out"?

Derek Rhodes ha dicho:

Hi, I've got a question. h says that n has a minimum value of 17, but there is a denominator on the right hand side in the expression 1 / (n - 17) which becomes 1 / 0. Is that intentional? I know that Mathlib has 1 / 0 = 0, but I think that case is generally avoided in Mathlib by including a hypothesis that forbids it from happening.

I see that's why choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial is written the way it is; to avoid division. I could try to restructure the argument to follow in that direction.

There is cancel_denoms, as listed over on this very helpful page:
https://seasawher.github.io/mathlib4-help/tactics/#cancel_denoms
not sure if that will help here though.

Also, I pinned n=18 and arrived at a False, not sure what's up with that.

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : ℕ) (h : n = 18) : (choose n 15 / choose n 17 : ℚ) = 272 * (1/(n-16) - 1/(n-17)) := by
  simp [h, choose]
  norm_num
  -- False
I have the fractions reversed, should be 1/(n-17) first.

Ah also, should be 15 16, not 16 17 (this takes care of the n=17 issue).
Sorry about all the mistakes.
making mistakes in the best way to learn :grinning:

Trying to work denominator-less-ly:

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : ℕ) (h : 17 ≤ n) : n ! = n.choose 15 * 15! * (n-15) * (n-16) * (n-17)! := by
  calc (n !)
    _ = n.choose 15 * 15! * (n-15)! := by
        rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial (show 15 ≤ n by linarith)]
    _ = n.choose 15 * 15! * (n-15) * (n-16)!          := by sorry
    _ = n.choose 15 * 15! * (n-15) * (n-16) * (n-17)! := by sorry

How can I do this?
o, looks interesting, will tinker around, but can't promise anything yet
Supposed to use factorial_succ but rw gives error. Not in the right form I guess...

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : Nat) : (n-15)! = (n-15) * (n-16)! := by sorry
-- gotta use factorial_succ?

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : Nat) (H : 16 ≤ n): (n-15)! = (n-15) * (n-16)! := by
  have t: (n - 15) = (n - 16 + 1) := by omega
  nth_rewrite 2 [t]
  rw [<- factorial_succ]; congr
(i really need to learn that calc mode some day...)

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n : ℕ) (h : 17 ≤ n) : n ! = n.choose 15 * 15! * (n-15) * (n-16) * (n-17)! := by
  rw [<- choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial (show 15 ≤ n by linarith)]
  rw [mul_assoc, mul_assoc, mul_assoc, mul_assoc]
  congr
  have t: n - 16 = n - 17 + 1 := by omega
  rw [t, <- factorial_succ, <- t]
  have t0: n - 15 = n - 16 + 1 := by omega
  rw [t0, <- factorial_succ, <- t0]
kinda hacked together, I don't like this (at least not completely)

It is possible to do that (the first unfinished proof) with that calc mode, but I was doing smth in wrong way, it seems.

import Mathlib
open Nat

example (n: ℕ) (h: 17 ≤ n): (choose n 15: ℚ) / (choose n 17: ℚ) = (272 : ℚ) * ((1: ℚ) / ((n - 16): ℚ) - (1: ℚ) / ((n - 15): ℚ)) := by
  have h15 : 15 ≤ n := by linarith
  have h16 : 16 ≤ n := by linarith
  have h17 : 17 ≤ n := by linarith
  have t0: 15! ≠ 0 := factorial_ne_zero 15
  have t2: 17! ≠ 0 := factorial_ne_zero 17
  have t1: (n - 15)! ≠ 0 := factorial_ne_zero (n - 15)
  have t3: (n - 17)! ≠ 0 := factorial_ne_zero (n - 17)
  have t4 := factorial_succ (n - 16)
  have t5 : n - 16 + 1 = n - 15 := by omega
  have t6 := factorial_succ (n - 17)
  have t7 : n - 17 + 1 = n - 16 := by omega
  have t8: n - 15 ≠ 0 := by omega
  have t9: n - 16 ≠ 0 := by omega
  have t10 {A B C: ℕ} (Ha: A ≠ 0) (Hb: B ≠ 0) (Hc: C ≠ 0): (A: ℚ) / ((B * C * A): ℚ) = 1 / (B * C : ℚ) := by field_simp; ring
  calc (choose n 15: ℚ) / (choose n 17 : ℚ)
    _ = (n ! / (15! * (n-15)!): ℚ) / (choose n 17 :ℚ) := by
        rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h15]
        congr; field_simp; ring
    _ = (n ! : ℚ) / (15! * (n - 15)! : ℚ) / ((n ! : ℚ) / (17! * (n - 17)! : ℚ)) := by
        rw [← choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h17]
        congr; field_simp; ring
    _ = ((n ! : ℚ) / (15! * (n-15)! : ℚ)) * ((17! * (n-17)! : ℚ) / (n ! : ℚ)) := by
        field_simp
    _ = (17! * (n-17)! : ℚ) / (15! * (n-15)! : ℚ) := by field_simp; ring
    _ = ((17! : ℚ) / (15! : ℚ)) * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15)! : ℚ)) := by apply mul_div_mul_comm
    _ = (17 * 16 * 15!) / (15! : ℚ) * (((n-17)! : ℚ)/ ((n-15)! : ℚ)) := by congr; norm_cast
    _ = ((17 * 16) * (15! : ℚ) / (15! : ℚ)) * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15)! : ℚ)) := by field_simp
    _ = (17 * 16) * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15)! : ℚ)) := by field_simp
    _ = 272 * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15)! : ℚ)) := by norm_num
    _ = 272 * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15: ℕ) * (n-16)! : ℚ)) := by congr; norm_cast; rw [<- t5, t4]
    _ = 272 * (((n-17)! : ℚ) / ((n-15: ℕ) * ((n-16: ℕ) * (n-17)! : ℚ))) := by congr; norm_cast; rw [<- t7, t6]
    _ = 272 * ((1: ℚ) / (((n-15: ℕ): ℚ) * ((n-16 : ℕ) : ℚ))) := by rw [<- mul_assoc, t10 t3 t8 t9]
    _ = 272 * ((1: ℚ)/((n-16): ℚ) - (1: ℚ)/(((n-15): ℚ))) := by
        norm_cast; simp; field_simp;
        have t11: (n: ℚ) - 16 ≠ 0 := by norm_cast
        have t12: (n: ℚ) - 15 ≠ 0 := by norm_cast
        field_simp; norm_num

import Mathlib
open Nat

def aux00 (n: ℕ) (h: 17 ≤ n): choose n 15 * 15! * (n - 15)! = choose n 17 * 17! * (n - 17)! := by
  rw [choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial (by linarith), choose_mul_factorial_mul_factorial h]

def aux01 (n: ℕ) (h: 17 ≤ n): choose n 15 * (n - 15) * (n - 16) = 272 * choose n 17 := by
  have t := aux00 n h
  have t0: 17! = 17 * 16 * 15! := by rw [factorial_succ, factorial_succ, mul_assoc];
  have t1: n - 15 = n - 17 + 1 + 1 := by omega
  have t2: (n - 15)! = (n - 15) * (n - 16) * (n - 17)! := by
    rw [t1, factorial_succ, factorial_succ, mul_assoc]; congr; omega
  have t3: n.choose 15 * 15! * ((n - 15) * (n - 16) * (n - 17)!) = n.choose 15 * (n - 15) * (n - 16) * 15! * (n - 17)! := by ring
  have t4: n.choose 17 * (17 * 16 * 15!) * (n - 17)! = 16 * 17 * n.choose 17 * 15! * (n - 17)! := by ring
  have t5 := factorial_ne_zero 15
  have t6 := factorial_ne_zero (n - 17)
  rw [t0, t2, t3, t4] at t; simp [t5, t6] at t; exact t

theorem THM (n: ℕ) (h: 17 ≤ n): (choose n 15: ℚ) / (choose n 17: ℚ) = 272 * (1 / (n - 16: ℚ) - 1 / ((n - 15): ℚ)) := by
  have t := aux01 n h
  have t0: (n: ℚ) - 15 ≠ 0 := by norm_cast; simp; omega
  have t1: (n: ℚ) - 16 ≠ 0 := by norm_cast; simp; omega
  have t2: (choose n 17 : ℚ) ≠ 0 := by simp; have t3 := Nat.choose_pos h; omega
  qify at t; field_simp at *; norm_num; rw [<- t, mul_assoc]; congr 1
  norm_cast; rw [Int.subNatNat_of_le (by linarith), Int.subNatNat_of_le (by linarith)]; norm_cast; ring

import Mathlib

open Nat

example (n : ℕ) (h : 17 ≤ n) : (choose n 15 / choose n 17 : ℚ) = 272 * ((n - 16 : ℚ)⁻¹ - (n - 15 : ℚ)⁻¹) := by
  have hq : (17 : ℚ) ≤ n := by exact_mod_cast h
  rw [mul_sub, ← div_eq_mul_inv, ← div_eq_mul_inv, div_sub_div 272 272 (by linarith) (by linarith)]
  apply div_eq_of_eq_mul (Nat.cast_ne_zero.mpr (Nat.choose_pos h).ne')
  rw [div_mul_eq_mul_div]
  apply eq_div_of_mul_eq (mul_ne_zero (by linarith) (by linarith))
  rw [mul_left_comm]
  conv_lhs =>
    enter [2, 2, 2]
    exact Nat.cast_ofNat.symm
  rw [← Nat.cast_sub (by linarith), ← Nat.cast_mul, ← Nat.choose_succ_right_eq, Nat.cast_mul, mul_left_comm, ← mul_assoc]
  conv_lhs =>
    enter [1, 2, 2]
    exact Nat.cast_ofNat.symm
  rw [← Nat.cast_sub (by linarith), ← Nat.cast_mul, ← Nat.choose_succ_right_eq]
  norm_num
  ring
